com.mpos.lottery.te.gamespec.sale

类 BaseTicket

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mpos.lottery.te.common.dao.BaseEntity
      • com.mpos.lottery.te.common.dao.SettlementEntity
        • com.mpos.lottery.te.gamespec.sale.BaseTicket
  • 所有已实现的接口:
    TeTransactionMessageSerializer, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable
    直接已知子类:
    BaseTamperProofTicket, BingoTicket, DigitalTicket, DummyTicket, ExtraBallTicket, Magic100Ticket, RaffleTicket, ToToTicket, VatTicket

    @MappedSuperclass
public abstract class BaseTicket
extends SettlementEntity
implements java.lang.Cloneable, TeTransactionMessageSerializer
    A base ticket definition for all game type.
    另请参阅:
    序列化表格

    • 方法详细资料

      • getGameInstance

        public abstract BaseGameInstance getGameInstance()
        This is a workaround of JPA's lack of polymorphic association. As BaseGameInstance is a @MappedSuperclass, no entity association can be annotated on it. But we need a unified interface for accessing game instance from BaseTicket, that is why these 2 abstract methods defined: getGameInstance() and setGameInstance().

        Refer to

        • https://hibernate.onjira.com/browse/EJB-199?focusedCommentId=32855&page =com .atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment- 32855
        • http://stackoverflow.com/questions/6853802/jpa-table-per-class-problems -with-manytoone
        I do agree with Don Tam's solution.

      • splitAmount

        public static java.math.BigDecimal[] splitAmount(Payment respPayment,
                                 java.math.BigDecimal requiredAmount,
                                 boolean isLast)
                                          throws ApplicationException
        Split the total amount among multiple tickets. For example, client buy a 3-draw ticket, and paid with voucher(capitalAmount:1000 + freeAmount:200). As the backend will generate 3 tickets records according, how to determine the total/free amount of each ticket records??

        The method will deduct capital amount of voucher first, then free amount. In our example the total amount, including capital and free amount, of each ticket is 400, the for the 1st ticket, the 400 will be deducted from capital amount.

        No. of LottoTicket capitalAmount freeAmount Status Of Voucher
        1 400 0 capitalAmount:600, freeAmount:200
        2 400 0 capitalAmount:600, freeAmount:200
        3 200 200 capitalAmount:0, freeAmount:0

        Absolutely at last the capital amount and free amount of voucher should both be 0.

        If buy tickets for multiple recievers, the amount splitting will follow same logic.

        While when you call this method, must keep in mind that respPayment shoud be a shared reference among multiple invocations, like below: 

         
 Payment respPayment = new Payment(new BigDecimal("1000"), new BigDecimal("200");
 BigDecimal requiredAmount = new BigDecimal("400");
 for (int i = 0; i < tickets.size(); i++){
          BigDecimal amounts[] = BaseTicket.splitAmount(respPayment, requiredAmount, 
            i == tickets.size() - 1 ? true : false);
          tickets.get(i).setTotalAmount(amounts[0]);
          tickets.get(i).setFreeAmount(amounts[1]);
 )
        参数:
        respPayment - The total amount which will be splitted, and following components must not be null: capitalAmount, freeAmount
        requiredAmount - The required amount. Every splitting must return the required amount.
        isLast - Is this split is the last? If true, then capital/free amount of respPayment must be 0.
        返回:
        a 2 length array of amount. The 1st will be capital amount, and the 2nd will be free amount.
        抛出:
        ApplicationException - CODE_EVENLY_DIVIDED_BASE_AMOUNT

      • clone

        public java.lang.Object clone()
        Deeply clone a LottoTicket. Here deeply means all entires will be cloned too, while associated transaction and game instance will keep untouched.
        覆盖:
        clone 在类中 java.lang.Object

      • setMultipleDraws

        public void setMultipleDraws(int multipleDraws)
        For a single draw ticket, the value of multipleDraw will be 1.

        If a multple-draws ticket, for example 3-draws, there will be 3 ticket entities, and each of them will associate with a game instance. The multipleDraws of 1st ticket entity which is associated with sold game instance will be 3, while value of multipleDraws of other 2 ticket entities will be 0.
